author: Max Rego
description: Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) Chief Pamela Smith announced Monday she is stepping down at the end of this year, a little more than two years after starting the D.C. role. “I am deeply humbled, grateful, and deeply appreciative of my time with the District of Columbia,” Smith said in a statement. “Serving as Chief of…
title: DC police chief stepping down amid Trump National Guard push

author: Ella Lee
description: The most elusive mystery of the days surrounding the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol attack has for years been the two pipe bombs planted outside the Democratic and Republican National Committee offices on the eve of the riot.  Clues emerged, like the suspect’s height and the distinctive Nike shoes he wore, but pressure mounted on the FBI as nearly five years passed with no arrests — until the end of last week. Brian…
title: DC pipe bomb mystery begins to unfurl

author: Julia Shapero
description: President Trump said Monday that he will allow Nvidia to sell its H200 chips to China in a key win for the chipmaker.  “I have informed President Xi, of China, that the United States will allow NVIDIA to ship its H200 products to approved customers in China, and other Countries, under conditions that allow for continued…
title: Trump says he will allow Nvidia to sell H200 chips to China

author: Ella Lee
description: President Trump cast blame on members of his own party Monday for halting some of his U.S. Attorney nominations — most recently for his former personal lawyer, Alina Habba. Habba announced earlier Monday she would step down as New Jersey’s top federal prosecutor after a panel of federal appeals court judges ruled she was unlawfully…
title: Trump blames stalled U.S. attorney nominations on GOP, blue slips after Alina Habba exit

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon said inflation may persist through the coming year, but that the stock market could remain at near-historic highs as well. Dimon gave his assessment of the “broader macro story” for the 2026 economy in an interview on Fox News’s “Sunday Morning Futures” this weekend. “In the short run, it looks…
title: Dimon: ‘Inflation is there and maybe not going down’

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: Lawmakers are aiming to withhold a portion of Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s travel budget until he provides the Armed Services committee in both chambers “unedited video” of strikes conducted against alleged drug boats in the Caribbean. The provision is included in the compromise version of the mammoth national defense policy bill known as the National…
title: Lawmakers seek to tie Hegseth’s travel budget to seeing boat strike footage

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Texas Rep. Jasmine Crockett, a rising star within the Democratic Party, on Monday launched a bid for Sen. John Cornyn’s (R-Texas) hotly contested seat, according to multiple news outlets. Crockett entered the primary field shortly before the candidate filing deadline passed on Monday afternoon, The Associated Press and other news outlets reported. She was among…
title: Crockett set to launch Texas Senate bid, shaking up Democratic primary

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: President Trump on Monday demurred when asked about an ongoing war between Netflix and Paramount for moviemaker Warner Bros. and said he has not spoken with his son-in-law Jared Kushner about his reported role in helping Paramount win the company’s board over. “I don’t know enough about it,” Trump told reporters at The White House.…
title: Trump on Netflix, Paramount war: ‘None of them are particularly good friends of mine’

author: Tara Suter
description: Joseph Hibbeln, a member of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP), said Monday that a vote to axe a recommendation that every newborn get the hepatitis B vaccine “wasn’t based on data.” “I repeatedly asked for it, and no data of harm was presented. There were speculations,…
title: CDC adviser: Newborn vaccine rollback ‘wasn’t based on data’

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Monday he would defer to Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth on whether to release video of a controversial military strike on an alleged drug boat in the Caribbean, shifting his stance from last week. ABC News correspondent Rachel Scott asked Trump whether he would direct Hegseth to release video of the Sept. 2…
title: Trump defers to Hegseth on releasing boat strike video in apparent shift

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The latest version of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) gives the Pentagon more time to use firefighting foam that contains “forever chemicals.” Lawmakers on Sunday released a negotiated version of the annual defense authorization bill that resolves differences between the House and Senate versions. Included in the measure is language from the House version of the…
title: Defense bill delays phaseout of ‘forever chemicals’ in firefighting foam

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday lashed out at an ABC News reporter after she pressed him on his comments about controversial military strikes on alleged drug boats, marking the latest instance in recent weeks of the president criticizing a female journalist. ABC’s Rachel Scott asked Trump whether he would direct Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to release…
title: Trump hits ABC reporter as ‘obnoxious’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) leads among young Democratic voters in a hypothetical 2028 presidential primary, according to a new survey. The Yale Youth Poll, released on Monday, shows Ocasio-Cortez with a double-digit lead over former Vice President Kamala Harris, California Gov. Gavin Newsom and other potential contenders when Democrats under 35 are asked which hypothetical…
title: Ocasio-Cortez early 2028 Democratic favorite among young voters: Poll

author: Max Rego
description: More American newborns are not receiving vitamin K shots, according to a study published Monday in the Journal of the American Medical Association.  The study found that from January 2017 to December 2024, 3.92 percent of the more than 5 million newborns in a U.S.-based electronic database did not receive a vitamin K shot. The…
title: More Americans refusing vitamin K shots for newborns, new study finds

author: Alexander Bolton
description: The Teamsters, one of the nation’s largest and most diverse unions with 1.3 million members, unveiled a Substack newsletter Monday, becoming the first major union to use the online forum to reach people outside traditional media. The move was spearheaded by Sean O’Brien, the general president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, who wants to…
title: Teamsters unveil new Substack newsletter to break through traditional media

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Bruna Ferreira, the mother of White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt’s nephew, is pushing back on the “disgusting” narrative from the Trump administration that she’s an absent mother and a criminal. Ferreira — who was detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents last month and faces possible removal to Brazil — has garnered national…
title: Mother of Karoline Leavitt’s nephew pushes back on ‘disgusting’ narrative

author: Joseph Choi
description: Separate Senate Republican contingents are floating competing proposals on health care, as the party struggles to unify behind a plan to stop looming premium hikes. GOP leaders are faced with a political dilemma: Either they extend the subsidies and endorse ObamaCare, which Republicans have long opposed, or they let the subsidies expire ahead of next…
title: Senate Republicans float competing health care plans

author: Ella Lee
description: Alina Habba, the former personal attorney to President Trump, is stepping down from her contested position atop the federal prosecuting office in New Jersey after federal courts ruled she was unlawfully appointed. She said in a post on X that she’ll continue to serve the Justice Department as a senior advisor to Attorney General Pam…
title: Alina Habba steps down as top federal prosecutor in New Jersey

author: Devin Willems
description: Cinnabon said, in part, that it does "not condone this behavior."
title: Wisconsin Cinnabon fires staffer after ‘disturbing’ viral video, company says

author: Harlan Ullman, opinion contributor
description: For Russian President Vladimir Putin and China’s Xi Jinping, events in America could not be more to their liking.
title: Give America enough rope…

author: Brett Samuels
description: A conservative advocacy group led by former Vice President Pence on Monday praised provisions in the annual defense bill that called for increased military spending and stripped out a proposal covering in vitro fertilization (IVF) for active duty military members. Advancing American Freedom (AAF) released a memo, titled “Calling Balls and Strikes on the Compromise…
title: Pence group praises ‘aggressive’ spending in annual defense bill

author: Laura Kelly
description: Congressional leaders on Sunday released the text of the 2026 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), a compromise defense policy bill that fully repeals sanctions on Syria, seeks to put restrictions on withdrawing service members positioned in Europe and provides some military assistance to Ukraine.  The massive legislation, which has a topline of about $8 billion…
title: Unpacking the $900 billion defense spending bill: What’s in? What’s out?

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Rep. Ilhan Omar is speaking out regarding massive welfare fraud allegations in Minnesota, her home state, under the watch of Gov. Tim Walz. Because the vast majority of the fraudsters are Somali, and because Ilhan Omar is herself a member of that community, she appeared on “Face the Nation” over the weekend to answer questions about the accusations made…
title: Ilhan Omar defends Somalis, says they are welfare fraud victims

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Congress’ annual defense policy bill does not include a provision expanding coverage of assisted reproductive technology for military members, including in-vitro fertilization, sparking the ire of lawmakers and advocates.  Currently, servicemembers’ TRICARE insurance only covers fertility services for military members whose infertility was caused by a serious or severe illness or injury while on active duty.  Earlier Senate and House versions of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) included a provision…
title: Democrats, advocates slam Johnson after IVF expansion stripped from defense policy bill

author: Cate Martel
description: 12:30 Report is The Hill’s midday newsletter. Subscribe here. It’s Monday. Welcome back! This week has already started with a bang. Let’s get into it. In today’s issue: • Paramount launches hostile bid for Warner Bros. • Supreme Court hears major Trump case • MTG’s fiery ‘60 Minutes’ interview • Allred drops Texas Senate bid…
title: Paramount launches hostile bid for Warner Bros. as acquisition fight heats up

author: Rep. Troy A. Carter, Sr. (D-La.), opinion contributor
description: The Trump administration is attempting to slash housing funding and punish homelessness, which will result in over 4,000 formerly homeless people in Louisiana being forced back onto the streets, and will not address the real driver of homelessness, which is the soaring cost of housing.
title: A coordinated attack on America’s most vulnerable

author: Kyle Balluck
description: President Trump is expected Monday afternoon to announce $12 billion in aid to farmers in the U.S. Farmers, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins are expected to join the president at the White House for the announcement. Watch the announcement, scheduled to begin at 2 p.m. EST, in the player above.
title: Watch live: Trump announces $12B in aid to farmers

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Talk about a bad beat, or was it? The Denver Broncos took care of their AFC West rival the Las Vegas Raiders on Sunday, but the end of the game left some fans and sports bettors scratching their heads. Denver, which was a seven-and-a-half-point favorite at kickoff, led the game 24-14 with 16 seconds to…
title: Raiders late spread-covering field goal leads to social media speculation of game rigging

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Education Department announced on Monday it is adding an earnings indicator at the end of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) process to warn students about institutions with poor financial outcomes.  During the FAFSA process, students indicate which prospective colleges they are interested in attending but need to go to separate sites…
title: Education Department says FAFSA will warn students looking at schools with low earning outcomes

author: Jos Joseph, opinion contributor
description: The military's strike on drug boats has brought into light the need to define what a war crime is, as the standard of conduct should be maintained at all times, even in the worst of conditions, and the responsibility for this restraint must come from the top.
title: War is hell, but that should never excuse war crimes.

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: South Carolina Rep. James Clyburn (D) said Sunday he doesn’t think the U.S. is ready for a woman to be president.  “If you look at the history, we demonstrated that we are not ready, these are incredible women who have run, Hillary Clinton, Kamala Harris,” Clyburn told NBC’s Kristen Welker on “Meet The Press.” “Just…
title: Clyburn: ‘We are not ready’ for a woman as president

author: Teddy Grant
description: Prince Harry has maintained without property security he wouldn’t be able to bring his family back to the U.K. for safety reasons.
title: Prince Harry wins security review that may let his kids visit King Charles

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick (Pa.), the author of a bipartisan health care plan and a moderate Republican whose district voted for former Vice President Kamala Harris in 2024, said taking no action on the expiring Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies is “not an option.” In an interview that aired Sunday on CNN’s “Inside Politics,” Fitpatrick pushed…
title: GOP Rep. Fitzpatrick: Doing nothing on health care ‘not an option’

author: Max Rego
description: Far-right activist Laura Loomer noted inconsistencies with the Trump administration’s justification of strikes on alleged drug trafficking boats off the coast of Venezuela. Loomer said Monday on the social platform X that while she has “no sympathy for narcoterrorists being killed,” it is “worth noting” that the majority of drugs, including fentanyl, brought into the…
title: Loomer on boat strikes: ‘Fentanyl isn’t being manufactured in Venezuela’

author: Steven Lubet, opinion contributor
description: He may well win his case on First Amendment grounds, but that will not absolve him of antisemitism.
title: A Kentucky professor’s free speech is no defense for antisemitism

author: Julia Mueller
description: More than half of voters say President Trump is losing the battle against inflation amid concerns about affordability under his administration, according to a Harvard CAPS/Harris poll released Monday. The poll found 57 percent of voters, including 21 percent of Republicans, thought the president is losing against inflation, though the figure is down slightly from…
title: 57 percent of voters say Trump is losing battle against inflation: Poll

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: It’s the rich and powerful taking care of the rich and powerful.
title: Trump’s handouts put billionaires first and Americans last

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) pushed back on CBS News anchor Lesley Stahl when she was asked to address past controversial statements that the journalist suggested have “contributed” to a toxic political culture. In perhaps the most contentious moment of the “60 Minutes” interview that aired Sunday, Stahl pressed the Georgia Republican about her change…
title: Greene, ’60 Minutes’ correspondent spar in tense interview

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: President Trump over the weekend acknowledged Netflix’s bid to acquire WarnerBros. Discovery could face hurtles, an admission that came as Paramount sought to stymie the deal with a competing bid for the massive moviemaker and fellow entertainment giant. “There’s no question about it,” Trump told reporters on Sunday when asked if the Netflix-WBD deal could face…
title: Trump: Netflix deal to acquire Warner Bros. ‘could be a problem’

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A federal judge on Saturday agreed to temporarily block Justice Department access to emails from a close associate of James Comey, issuing another roadblock as prosecutors weigh bringing a second case against the former FBI director. A different federal judge recently tossed the case against Comey, determining U.S. Attorney Lindsey Halligan was not properly appointed…
title: DOJ dealt setback in effort to reindict Comey

author: Rich McHugh
description: A whistleblower says a Maine health company, run by a Somali-American, charged the state for work it never did.
title: Maine whistleblower alleges Minnesota-like fraud in state’s Medicaid program

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump is slated to roll out a $12 billion farm aid package on Monday, according to a White House official.  The aid includes $11 billion in one time payments to crop farmers as a part of the Department of Agriculture’s Farmer Bridge Assistance program. The remaining $1 billion will go toward crops that are…
title: White House to roll out $12 billion farm package

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday lashed out at Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) after she appeared on “60 Minutes” to discuss her rift with the president and decision to retire from Congress in January. “The only reason Marjorie ‘Traitor’ Brown (Green turns Brown under stress!) went BAD is that she was JILTED by the President of…
title: Trump hits Greene after ’60 Minutes’ appearance: Not America First or MAGA

author: Max Rego
description: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani gave advice to migrants in the city, just over a week after federal immigration officers conducted a sweep near Chinatown.  Mamdani said that as mayor, he would “protect the rights” of the roughly three million migrants in New York City in a video on the social platform X.  The…
title: Mamdani gives tips to migrants in New York City

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The daughter of Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) said President Trump’s targeted attack on her father has released a firestorm of negativity aimed at her family in recent days. In a since-deleted TikTok video posted on Saturday, Hope Walz fiercely defended her family after Trump called her father “seriously ret—ed,” saying she draws a line…
title: Hope Walz: Trump slur against father unleashed ‘s—storm’ toward family

author: Max Rego
description: One reason Sylvester Stallone played Rocky Balboa was because other stars were too “flabby,” according to President Trump. “They brought in stars, but the stars didn’t have good bodies. They were flabby,” Trump said Saturday at a dinner honoring Stallone and four other Kennedy Center honorees. “They were not really boxers and Sly would look…
title: Trump: Other stars were too ‘flabby’ to play ‘Rocky’

author: The Hill Staff
description: The Supreme Court on Monday will hear a major case that will test the limits of presidential power. The case stems from President Trump’s bid to fire a Federal Trade Commission member without cause and will likely determine the future of independent agencies’ heads. This afternoon, the Senate returns to Washington, where a rebellion within…
title: Live updates: Supreme Court weighs Trump’s power to fire independent boards

description: The Supreme Court on Monday will consider the future of independent agencies, hearing oral arguments on President Trump’s bid to fire a Federal Trade Commission (FTC) member without cause.  A win for Trump could eviscerate 90 years of Supreme Court precedent. Listen to the arguments, scheduled to begin at 10 a.m. EST, in the player…
title: Listen live: Supreme Court weighs Trump’s firing of FTC commissioner

author: Austin Sarat, opinion contributor
description: Donald Trump will say or do anything to bury the legacy of a predecessor he despises: Barack Obama.
title: Understanding Trump’s obsession with ObamaCare

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: More Americans approve of the Affordable Care Act (ACA) than at any point since it took effect more than a decade ago, according to a new Gallup survey. In the survey, released Monday, 57 percent of respondents approve, and 35 percent of respondents disapprove of the landmark legislation, which, the survey notes, was “signed into…
title: ACA approval hits new high: Gallup

author: William S. Becker, opinion contributor
description: Trump's policy on dealing with Venezuelan drug smugglers appears to have as many holes as the boats it has been sinking.
title: Forget Hegseth — are Trump and Congress culpable in the disputed boat attack?

author: Peter Navarro, opinion contributor
description: Middleman Big Beef commands the ultimate supply chain position.
title: Do we need to break up Big Beef?

author: Clare Gehlich
description: A furry "suspect" that ransacked a Virginia ABC (Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority) store before passing out in a bathroom after becoming "intoxicated" has inspired T-shirts, a promotional campaign, and now, cocktails.
title: ‘Intoxicated’ raccoon gets its own cocktails, T-shirts after ransacking Virginia liquor store

author: Kelly Wiley
description: More than 130 people were killed in the catastrophic flooding in Texas this summer, including 27 campers and counselors at an all-girls Christian camp.
title: ‘What do we do?’: 911 calls reveal pleas for rescue from Texas camps during floods

author: Terré Gables/KFOR
description: Another OU instructor has been removed amidst the controversy over one student's failing grade.
title: Another instructor removed by University of Oklahoma amid protest over student’s failing grade

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The booming business of college sports is getting out of control, lawmakers on both sides of the aisle agree, but whether Congress should intervene and how to effectively level the playing field between premier universities and smaller schools is a heated debate on Capitol Hill.   The stalemate was highlighted last week by the death of…
title: GOP lawmakers get heated over college football and money

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Republican leaders are hoping that President Trump will intervene to quell a conservative rebellion in the upper chamber against a package of spending bills that Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) is trying to advance before Christmas. Conservative Sens. Mike Lee (R-Utah), Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) and Rick Scott (R-Fla.) have brought a package of…
title: Republicans look to Trump to quell conservative rebellion in Senate

author: Ella Lee
description: The future of independent agencies heads to the Supreme Court on Monday as it hears oral arguments on President Trump’s bid to fire a Federal Trade Commission (FTC) member without cause.  A win for Trump could eviscerate 90 years of Supreme Court precedent that has enabled Congress to protect FTC commissioners and a handful of…
title: Supreme Court to weigh Trump’s firing of FTC commissioner

author: Judy Kurtz
description: It had the look of a traditional Kennedy Center Honors ceremony — but following President Trump’s unprecedented overhaul of the D.C. arts institution earlier this year and with the commander in chief making history as the show’s host, change was in the air at this year’s awards gathering. “Welcome to a very special evening —…
title: KISS, Sylvester Stallone among Trump-hosted Kennedy Center Honors recipients: ‘I’m going to try to act like Johnny Carson’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.), once a staunch supporter of President Trump’s MAGA agenda, now suggested she no longer associates herself with that label. “Are you MAGA?” anchor Lesley Stahl asked Greene in an interview on CBS’s “60 Minutes,” which aired on Sunday. “I’m America first,” Greene replied. Stahl pressed: “And that’s not the same…
title: Greene rejects ‘MAGA’ label: ‘I’m America first’

author: Mark R. Whittington, opinion contributor
description: The situation has ramifications for both the ISS and Russia’s future as a space power.
title: Russia is out of the human spaceflight business — for now

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) doubled down on her criticism of President Trump in an interview on CBS’s “60 Minutes” on Sunday, less than a month after the longtime Trump ally announced she would resign from Congress amid her public feud with the president. In the interview, Greene stood by the defiant stances she’s taken…
title: 5 takeaways from Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene’s ’60 Minutes’ interview

author: Jonathan Carter
description: President Trump on Sunday said he does not think Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is ready to sign off on a U.S.-proposed peace plan between Ukraine and Russia. The president, in an exchange with reporters ahead of his hosting the Kennedy Center Honors in Washington, D.C., expressed concern regarding Zelensky’s thoughts on the peace plan. This…
title: Trump: ‘I’m not sure Zelensky is fine with’ peace proposal

author: Jonathan Carter
description: Congressional leaders released the final bill text the 2026 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) on Sunday, as they seek to get the annual defense policy bill across the finish line. The budget for the Department of Defense is $8 billion more than the $892.6 billion in President Trump’s budget request for the department. The defense…
title: Johnson: Defense bill advances ‘Peace Through Strength Agenda’

author: Jonathan Carter
description: Congressional leaders on Sunday released the text of the national defense and security package, the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA). The budget for the Department of Defense is $8 billion more than the $892.6 billion in President Trump’s budget request for the department. The NDAA does not appropriate funds but rather sets the policy for…
title: Read: Full text of the National Defense Authorization Act
